ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc16:1.1_0: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc16:1.2_0: At that time the monks from the group of six had taken possession of the best sleeping places, but the senior monks made them move.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc16:1.4_0: “How can we stay here for the rains residence right here?”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc16:1.5_0: They then arranged their sleeping places in a way that encroached on the senior monks, thinking,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc16:1.7_0: The monks of few desires complained and criticized Udāyī,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc16:1.8_0: “How can the monks from the group of six arrange their sleeping places in a way that encroaches on the senior monks?”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc16:1.9_0: After criticizing those monks in many ways, they told the Buddha ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc16:1.10_0: “Is it true, monks, that you did this?”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc16:1.13_0: “... Foolish men, how can you arrange your sleeping places in a way that encroaches on the senior monks?
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc16:1.14_0: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it ...” ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc16:1.15_0: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc16:1.16.1_0: ‘If, in a dwelling belonging to the Sangha, a monk arranges his sleeping place in a way that encroaches on a monk that he knows arrived there before him, with the intention that anyone who feels crowded will leave, and he does so only for this reason and no other, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc16:2.1.4_0: ...The monk who has been given the full ordination by a unanimous Sangha through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of monk is meant in this case.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc16:2.1.5_0: A dwelling belonging to the Sangha:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc16:2.1.6_0: given to the Sangha, given up to the Sangha.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc16:2.1.8_0: he knows that he is senior, he knows that he is sick, he knows that it was given to him by the Sangha.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc16:2.1.11_0: Lays down in the same sleeping place:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc16:2.1.12_0: if he puts out his sleeping place in the vicinity of the bed, the bench, the entry way, or the departure way, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc16:2.1.13_0: If he sits down or lies down on it, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc16:2.1.14_0: He does so only for this reason and no other:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc16:2.1.15_0: there is no other reason for arranging his sleeping place in a way that encroaches.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc16:2.2.1_0: If it belongs to the Sangha, and he perceives it as such, and he arranges his sleeping place there in a way that encroaches, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc16:2.2.2_0: If it belongs to the Sangha, but he is unsure of it, and he arranges his sleeping place there in a way that encroaches, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc16:2.2.3_0: If it belongs to the Sangha, but he perceives it as belonging to an individual, and he arranges his sleeping place there in a way that encroaches, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc16:2.2.4_0: If he puts out his sleeping place, or has it put out, anywhere apart from the vicinity of the bed, the bench, the entry way, or the departure way, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc16:2.2.5_0: If he sits down or lies down on it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc16:2.2.6_0: If he puts out bedding, or has it put out, in the vicinity of a dwelling, in the assembly hall, under a roof-cover, or at the foot of a tree, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc16:2.2.7_0: If he sits down or lies down on it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc16:2.2.8_0: If it belongs to an individual, but he perceives it as belonging to the Sangha, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc16:2.2.9_0: If it belongs to an individual, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc16:2.2.10_0: If it belongs to an individual, and he perceives it as such, but that individual is not himself, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc16:2.2.11_0: If it belongs to himself, there is no offense.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc16:2.3.1_0: there is no offense for him.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc16:2.3.2_0: if he enters because he is sick;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc16:2.3.6_0: if he is the first offender.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc16:2.3.7_0: The sixth rule, the training rule on encroaching, is finished.
